title: Ronnie Ortiz-Magro 'feels pretty horrible' and is struggling to 'digest' drug-fueled arrest
text:
Ronnie Ortiz-Magro is struggling to come to grips with his kidnapping arrest.

'He’s very somber. He’s trying to put himself in a place mentally where he’s going to be able to digest all of this. It’s a lot for him to take in,' said an Us Weekly source.

The 33-year-old Jersey Shore star, whose arrest came after he allegedly hit his girlfriend Jen Harley, 'feels pretty horrible, but he’s in an OK space. He’s just trying to process what just happened.'

'Trying to process': Ronnie Ortiz-Magro is struggling to come to grips with his kidnapping arrest and is 'very somber'; pictured in New York this July

Ronnie was released from police custody before noon on Friday, nearly 10 hours after being arrested following a drug-fueled rampage.

He ran out of the center to a waiting vehicle shortly after Jen was spotted leaving their battered AirBnB with their 18-month-old daughter Ariana.

The 33-year-old was taken into police custody after reportedly 'striking' Harley at an AirBnB rental at around 2:30 a.m., according to TMZ.

Video shot by TMZ showed the reality TV star emerging from the Van Nuys Jail and being whisked away in a black Mercedes.

Ortiz-Magro, 33, is pictured being taken into custody during his arrest in Los Angeles early Friday morning stemming from a drug-fueled altercation with Jen Harley

The muscle-bound reality star appeared stone-faced as he was being loaded into the back of an ambulance after having a stun gun deployed against him

Booking information revealed that Ortiz was booked into the system at 8 a.m. and was released at 11:26 a.m.

Jen kept completely covered up as she left the rental unit with a grey blanket over her head.

She appeared to be wearing a black sweatshirt and matching pants, and carried a plus pink wheeled backpack in her arm.

A friend helped the mother-of-two carry her little girl into a white SUV and a driver say behind the wheel of the vehicle.

The Jersey Shore alum was taken to a hospital to be checked out before getting booked on kidnapping charges

Ronnie allegedly 'slapped and punched Jen' before chasing her around the home with a knife while he was carrying their baby daughter, Ariana Sky.

The gossip site reported that police 'broke down the door' to the rental because they were worried the 18-month-old little girl was in danger.

Ronnie reportedly refused to 'go peacefully' and officers were forced to use a taser on the muscle-bound reality star.

TMZ on Friday obtained video from Fox 11 showing officers placing the topless Ortiz-Magro on a gurney in a seated position and restraining his hands.

Harley was spotted walking outside the couple's rental after her boyfriend's dramatic arrest

Ronnie was reportedly holding his and Jen's 18-month-old daughter, Ariana Sky (pictured with her parents) while brandishing a knife

Hours before the arrest: Jen and Ronnie were all-smiles at the launch of Verge CBD before he was taken into police custody

In the footage, the heavily tattooed 33-year-old appears stone-faced and stares straight ahead without blinking while being loaded by paramedics into the back of an awaiting ambulance.

The video also shows Harley, dressed in a black T-shirt with a sports drink in hand, standing outside her residence. As soon as she spots cameras trained on her, she uses her long ombre locks to obscure her face and quickly walks away.

Harley initially placed 911 calls 'in distress' after running around the home screaming for help when Ronnie began chasing her with a knife.

According to a 911 tape obtained by TMZ, Harley pressed a panic button inside the AirBnB in the the 7200 block of Woodrow Wilson Drive during the clash with Ortiz-Magro.

She also relayed to authorities that Ronnie 'went off the rails after doing coke.'

Police handcuffed Ortiz-Magro to a gurney after using a taser to subdue him

Just hours before the couple's quarrel, Harley proudly showed off her new 'bling' that she got for National Boyfriend's Day. She posted a video displaying a necklace on Instagram Stories

Wow: They confirmed their status as a couple that afternoon, ignoring advice from friends and family to keep their distance from each other after years of a tumultuous relationship

He eventually dropped the knife and locked himself in the house with his daughter.

Paramedics on scene 'checked out Jen and the baby' and neither suffered any major injuries, although the 31-year-old woman did reportedly have visible marks on her face.

Ronnie was taken to a nearby hospital to be evaluated and was later booked into jail for kidnapping.

Hours before the incident, Harley posted a video on Instagram Stories quoting lyrics from the G-Eazy hit 'Him & I,' including the verses: 'He's out of his head, I'm out of my mind/We got that love, the crazy kind.'

In another video, the 31-year-old Harley showed off a new necklace.

'For National Boyfriend Day, I got some new bling,' Harley wrote over the video. She tagged Rodeo Drive as her location.

She wore her sparkling present later that same day when she accompanied her boyfriend to the Verge CBD event, where the pair put on a loved-up display.

The event launching Ortiz-Magro's new line of CBD products was held at Poppy, a night club near the Sunset Strip.

Yikes: Ronnie was in a lively mood at the Verge CBD launch, and just hours later was arrested following a drug-fueled rampage

Both Ortiz-Magro and Harley used social media to promote his line of CBD products, which he launched at Thursday night's event at Poppy night club

Ortiz-Magro and Harley confirmed their status as a couple, ignoring advice from friends and family to keep their distance from each other.

'Honestly, even though everyone thinks we're toxic, she really does balance me out,' Ortiz-Magro said of Harley in an exclusive interview with Us Weekly. 'She really does keep me level because with her I have her and the baby, which is a family, which is what I want at the end of the day.'

Harley still had her new necklace on that night, when things between her and Ortiz-Magro took an apparently violent turn at their residence.

Fox 11 reported that Harley apparently misplaced her jewelry during the scuffle and appeared distraught. Police helped her retrieve the necklace from behind a garbage can on the street.

On Friday afternoon, Harley emerged form the rental property carrying her daughter in her arms. The toddler was covered with a blanket to shield her from news cameras.

Harley, sporting a black T-shirt and leggings, placed Ariana in the backseat of a white Chevy minivan and drove off after refusing to answer any questions.

Jen was recently cleared of domestic battery stemming from a fight in Las Vegas on New Year's Eve where Ronnie claimed she threw an ashtray at his head.

The couple welcomed their daughter in April 2018, but have publicly waged warfare against each other on social media with accusations of cheating and drug usage.

At the beginning of the year, Ronnie entered a month-long rehabilitation program to address his issues with alcohol and depression.

Harley also posted a video to her Instagram Stories featuring lyrics from the G-Eazy hit 'Him & I' (left and right)
description: The 33-year-old Jersey Shore star, whose arrest came after he allegedly hit his girlfriend Jen Harley, 'feels pretty horrible, but he's in an OK space. He's just trying to process what just happened.'
